channel.title: Mississippi River/Gulf of Mexico Hypoxia Task Force
channel.description: Updated Mississippi River/Gulf of Mexico Hypoxia Task Force content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Integrated Assessment of Hypoxia in the Northern Gulf of Mexico and Hypoxia Assessment Reports
item.description:
The “Integrated Assessment of Hypoxia in the Northern Gulf of Mexico” was developed by the White House National Science and Technology Council (NSTC) and the White House Committee on Environment and Natural Resources (CENR). The Integrated Assessment was finalized as one document summarizing six Hypoxia Assessment Reports in 2000, and set the scientific basis for the Hypoxia Task Force 2001 Action Plan. 

  • Integrated Assessment of Hypoxia in the Northern Gulf of Mexico (PDF)(66 pp, 13 MB, 2000)
  • Characterization of Hypoxia: Topic 1 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(203 pp, 13 MB, 1999)
  • Ecological and Economic Consequences of Hypoxia: Topic 2 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(63 pp, 375 K, 1999)
  • Flux and Sources of Nutrients in the Mississippi-Atchafalaya River Basin: Topic 3 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(159 pp, 4 MB, 1999)
  • Effects of Reducing Nutrient Loads to Surface Waters within the Mississippi River Basin and the Gulf of Mexico: Topic 4 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(158 pp, 4 MB, 1999)
  • Reducing Nutrient Loads, Especially Nitrate-Nitrogen, to Surface Water, Ground Water, and the Gulf of Mexico: Topic 5 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(134 pp, 6 MB, 1999)
  • Evaluation of the Economic Costs and Benefits of Methods for Reducing Nutrient Loads to the Gulf of Mexico: Topic 6 Hypoxia Assessment Report (PDF)(137 pp, 4 MB, 1999)
item.dc:creator: kreumanm

item.title: Priority Watershed Selection Processes in Hypoxia Task Force States
item.description:
Each HTF state has designated priority watersheds as part of their nutrient reduction strategy. A map of the priority watersheds is available on the HTF Nutrient Reduction Strategy page. The document below details each state's selection process.

  • Priority Watershed Selection Process (PDF)(3 pp, 235 K)
item.dc:creator: kreumanm

item.title: Report on Point Source Progress in Hypoxia Task Force States
item.description:
This document, released on March 1, 2016, represents the first ever report addressing the extent of nitrogen and phosphorus monitoring and discharge limits for major sewage treatment plants within the borders of the 12 states comprising the Hypoxia Task Force. These specific permit activities, along with other elements of the state nutrient reduction strategies, will continue progress toward reducing nitrogen and phosphorus pollution in the Mississippi/Atchafalaya River Basin.

 
  • Report on Point Source Progress in Hypoxia Task Force States (PDF)(80 pp, 3 MB, February 2016)
item.dc:creator: kreumanm

item.title: LGU HTF Non-Funded Cooperative Agreement
item.description:
This Non-Funded Cooperative Agreement was entered into on March 25th, 2014 by the Hypoxia Task Force and the Land Grant Universities located in Hypoxia Task Force states.

  • LGU HTF Cooperative Agreement (PDF)(4 pp, 897 K, March 25, 2014)
item.dc:creator: kreumanm

item.title: HTF 2015 Report to Congress
item.description:
In accordance with the Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014, this Report to Congress describes the progress made through activities directed by the Hypoxia Task Force toward attainment of the goals of the Gulf Hypoxia Action Plan 2008.

  • HTF 2015 Report to Congress (PDF)(98 pp, 5 MB, 2015)
item.dc:creator: kreumanm

item.title: Hypoxia Task Force Meetings and Events
item.description:
The Mississippi River/Gulf of Mexico Watershed Nutrient Task Force holds public meetings throughout the Mississippi River Basin to inform the public of the progress toward moving forward on Gulf Hypoxia. On this page, related meetings are posted as well.

 

Upcoming Events

TBA
 
 

Upcoming Related Events

(Not hosted by the Hypoxia Task Force)

National Assocation of Conservation Districts 2017 Annual Meeting
Dates: January 28-February 1, 2017
Location: Denver, CO
 
State of the Gulf of Mexico 2017 - One Gulf Summit
Dates: March 26-March 30, 2017
Location: Houston, TX
 
River Rally 2017
Dates: May 8-May 11, 2017
Location: Grand Rapids, MI
 
72nd Soil and Water Conservation Society International Annual Conference - Conservation Connections
Dates: July 30-August 2, 2017
Location: Madison, WI
 
 

Past Events

American Society of Agronomy, Crop Science Society of America, and Soil Science Society of America 2016 Annual Meeting: ​Resilience Emerging from Scarcity and Abundance
Dates: November 6-9, 2016
Location: Phoenix, AZ
 
2016 SERA-17 Meeting
Dates: November 9-10, 2016
Location: Phoenix, AZ
 
Sustainable Agriculture Summit
Dates: November 15-16, 2016
Location: Atlanta, GA
 
71st Soil and Water Conservation Society International Annual Conference - Great River LandscapesExit
Dates: July 24-27, 2016
Location: Louisville, KY
 
National Nonpoint Source Monitoring WorkshopExit
Dates: August 23-25, 2016
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
 
River Rally 2016Exit 
Dates: May 20-23, 2016 
Location: Mobile, AL
 
10th National Monitoring Conference: Working Together for Clean WaterExit
Dates: May 2-6, 2016
Location: Tampa, FL
 
Nutrient Management and Edge of Field Monitoring: From the Great Lakes to the GulfExit
Dates: December 1-3, 2015
Location: Memphis, TN
 
EPA-USDA National Workshop on Water Quality Trading MarketsExit
Dates: September 15-17, 2015
Location: Lincoln, NE
 

River Rally 2015Exit
Dates: May 1-4, 2015
Location: Santa Ana Pueblo, NM

2015 Gulf of Mexico Alliance All Hands MeetingExit
Dates: June 16-18, 2015
Location: Biloxi, MS

Coastal & Estuarine Research Federation 2015 ConferenceExit
Dates: November 8-12, 2015
Location: Portland, OR

 
 

Past Hypoxia Task Force Meetings

Hypoxia Task Force December 2016 Public Meeting & Webcast
Date: Tuesday, December 6, 2016
Time: 8:30 am to 12:00 pm Central Time, 9:30 am to 1:00 pm Eastern Time
Location: Renaissance New Orleans Pere Marquette French Quarter Area Hotel, New Orleans, LA 
Website: https://water-meetings.tetratech.com/Hypoxia/StaticPublic/index.htm
 

Materials from previous Task Force meetings can be found on the Hypoxia Task Force Meeting Summaries and Agendas page.

item.title: Gulf Hypoxia and Local Water Quality Concerns Workshop
item.description:
One of four symposia conducted as part of the Reassessment with the purpose of assessing the current state of the science of hypoxia. It was held from September 26-28, 2005, in Ames, IA.

  • Presentations and Agenda (PDF)(205 pp, 2 MB, 2005)

item.title: Hypoxia in the Northern Gulf of Mexico: Assessing the State of the Science
item.description:
One of four symposia conducted as part of the Reassessment with the purpose of assessing the current state of the science of hypoxia. It was held from April 25-27, 2006 in New Orleans, LA.

The following links exit the site Exit

  • Paper Prepared by Session 1 Author
